StoryText: I'm in my bed about to go to sleep when my grandmother comes in my room muttering in a confusing manner.
Question: The real problem is that my grandmother died several months ago. What should I do?

OptionText.Text: Go up to her and hug her
Hide under my blankets, ignore her, it's a dream.

OptionResult.Result: She screams and shoves me and I crash into my dresser and hurt myself
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: Somehow no one else hears the scream besides me, even though it was loud. Meanwhile, I am in pain, bruises on my back, cuts on my arms. And my grandmother vanished. Now, I can't fall asleep.

OptionResult.Result: She looks directly at me, tells me to look in her old sewing kit and vanishes.
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: We got her sewing kit after she died and it was stored out in the garage. I immediately go to the garage and find it buried in a box. I open it up and there's $400 in there! It must have been money she was saving for something. I guess... to give to me? My family was getting ready to throw that kit out. I now have a whole new understanding of the world.

OptionResult.Result: I hide under the blankets until this dream ends. Eventually she vanishes and now there is $10 on my nightstand.
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: OK, I thought that was a dream at first... but then $10 inexplicably shows up on my nightstand after my grandma vanishes. That couldn't have been a dream. There's no other reason that money could've showed up there. I do remember back when my grandma was alive she said she had money saved for me... is she trying to give me money?
